fullText: Sean Hayes gives a performance of such emotional range and technical skill that you forget he's not actually Oscar Levant, the neurotic, self-deprecating pianist and wit who was a fixture of mid-20th-century entertainment.

bwwExcerpt: Oscar Levant, the troubled midcentury musician and wag, often said he’d erased 'the fine line between genius and insanity.' He says it again, or a version of it, in 'Good Night, Oscar,' the unconvincing biographical fantasia that opened Monday at the Belasco Theater. But on the evidence of the character as written, and especially as impersonated by Sean Hayes in a gloomy if accurate performance, Levant doesn’t erase the line so much as fudge it.
